CLI: Implement pxf migrate command

Implement the pxf migrate command that allows migration of older
versions of PXF into a new installation of PXF. For example, for PXF
versions prior to 6.0, PXF used a configuration property called PXF_CONF
to specify a directory where PXF configurations are stored.

Now, PXF configurations live under PXF_HOME, this configuration
directory can be relocated to a different location. The base location
for configurations in PXF has been renamed to PXF_BASE.

Migration of PXF_CONF to PXF_BASE is enabled by the pxf migrate command
which does the following:
- Copies the $PXF_CONF/conf/pxf-profiles.xml file to $PXF_BASE/conf/pxf-profiles.xml
- Copies the $PXF_CONF/{servers,lib,keytabs} directories to $PXF_BASE
- Merges values of $PXF_CONF/conf/pxf-env.sh into two different files
  (depending on the property), the two files are
  ${PXF_BASE}/conf/pxf-application.properties and
  ${PXF_BASE}/conf/pxf-env.sh

PXF_BASE. The pxf migrate utility validates that the PXF_CONF and
PXF_BASE directories are valid directories.
